docs.text:
Welcome to ESP32.vn
#


Pinout
#




Đặc điểm và tính năng
#




Kết nối không dây:


Wi-Fi:
 150.0 Mbps data rate with HT40 (40 MHz channel width, 400 ns guard interval, 1 spatial stream, 64-QAM, 5/6 coding rate).


Bluetooth:
 Bluetooth LE (low energy) 
 legacy Bluetooth.


Processor:
 Xtensa Dual-Core 32-bit LX6 microprocessor, running at 160 or 240
MHz, and with performance characteristics of up to 600 DMIPS. (You can have your own application processor without having to worry about the Wi-Fi portion.)


Low power:
 Low power options to ensure that you can still do ADC conversions, computation, level thresholds, etc., while in deep sleep.


ROM:
 448 KByte ROM.


RAM:
 520 kByte SRAM.


Peripheral input/output:
 Rich peripheral interface with DMA that includes capacitive touch, ADCs (analog-to-digital converter), DACs (digital-to-analog converter), I²C (Inter-Integrated Circuit), UART (universal asynchronous receiver/transmitter), SPI (Serial Peripheral Interface), I²S (Integrated Interchip Sound), RMII (reduced media-independent interface), and PWM (Pulse Width Modulation).


Security:
 Hardware accelerators for AES and SSL/TLS.




Community Discussion
#


Tools Code
#


Chips Boards
#


Chips
#




ESP31B
 — Used for beta testing purposes on the pre-release ESP-WROOM-03 module.


ESP32-D0WDQ6
 — Initial chip release of the ESP32 series. [John Lee said 
there are variations on all of these
][2] with regard to the trailing attribute identifier code.


D
: Dual-core


0
: No internal flash


W
: Wi-Fi


D
: Dual-mode Bluetooth


Q
: Quad Flat No-leads (QFN) package


6
: 6
mm × 6
mm package body size








Module Boards
#




Espressif ESP-WROOM-03
 —
Pre-release beta test module that used the ESP31B.


Espressif ESP-WROOM-32
 —
Official release module board [created by Espressif][3].


AI-Thinker ESP3212
 —
Module based on the form factor of the AI-Thinker ESP-12F module.




Other Boards
#




Espressif ESP_Module_Testboard
 — Simple break-out board included with ESP-WROOM-03 beta modules.


Espressif ESP32_Demo Board_V2
 — A large development demo board created by Espressif for the ESP-WROOM-32 module.


HydraBus HydraESP32
 — HydraESP32 HydraBus v1.0 shield/breakout board for ESP-WROOM-32. This shield can be used with or without a HydraBus board.


ESP32-MODULE-KIT V1.0
 — [From vendor unknown, a NodeMCU-like board that incorporates an ESP32 module.][4]

Bluetooth:  Bluetooth LE (low energy)   legacy Bluetooth.  Processor:  Xtensa Dual-Core 32-bit LX6 microprocessor, running at 160 or 240 MHz, and with performance characteristics of up to 600 DMIPS. (You can have your own application processor without having to worry about the Wi-Fi portion.)  Low power:  Low power options to ensure that you can still do ADC conversions, computation, level thresholds, etc., while in deep sleep.  ROM:  448 KByte ROM.  RAM:  520 kByte SRAM.  Peripheral input/output:  Rich peripheral interface with DMA that includes capacitive touch, ADCs (analog-to-digital converter), DACs (digital-to-analog converter), I²C (Inter-Integrated Circuit), UART (universal asynchronous receiver/transmitter), SPI (Serial Peripheral Interface), I²S (Integrated Interchip Sound), RMII (reduced media-independent interface), and PWM (Pulse Width Modulation).  Security:  Hardware accelerators for AES and SSL/TLS.
